Pre-Game Insights: India and Pakistan are playing in New York for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
India has been based in New York since they landed in the USA, while Pakistan only got to New York before sunrise on Friday.
Pakistan's poor start in the USA adds spice to this game.
Pakistan's chances of qualifying for the Super Eights will be at the mercy of other results going their way if they lose to India.
India appears stable, while Pakistan not so much.
Pitch and Conditions: The quality of drop-in pitches in New York has been substandard.
Fast bowlers have dominated the games so far in New York.
The weather in New York was sunny on the eve of the match, but some weather websites have forecast showers for Sunday morning.
Team News: India is likely to play the same XI that beat Ireland by eight wickets.
Imad Wasim did not play Pakistan's game against USA due to a rib-cage injury, but head coach Gary Kirsten said he is fit and will play against India.
Azam Khan, who made a golden duck in Dallas, could get dropped.
In the Spotlight: Babar Azam had a shocker against USA: 4 off 14 balls in the powerplay, 24 balls before his first boundary, and dismissed for 44 off 43 just when Pakistan desperately needed him to continue the momentum.
Shivam Dube, who was picked in the XI primarily as a left-hand disruptor of spin in the middle overs, could face less spin against Pakistan.
Stats and Trivia: In the first four T20 World Cup matches played in New York, fast bowlers have taken 45 wickets and spinners only 10.
Babar scored a match-winning 68 off 52 balls against India in Dubai in the 2021 T20 World Cup, and was dismissed for a golden duck by Arshdeep Singh in Melbourne in 2022.
